commit_message:
Add SOURCE_IP_PORT to LB_ALGORITHM allowed values

This change adds SOURCE_IP_PORT to lb_algorithm property of
OS::Octavia::Pool resource which is missing from the available options
and required when using the OVN provider driver.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/ovn-octavia-provider/latest/admin/driver.html#limitations-of-the-ovn-provider-driver
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/octavia/train.html

Story: 2008361
Task: 41268

Change-Id: Ibed37eea817a5125c5751b2bc9f44acf3c016fe1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-15 16:35:58.000000000', 'message': 'Pass multipath config while creating connector object

Currently we only pass the configured multipath option when getting
the connector properties and do not pass it when creating the
connector object which in turn does the multipathing in os-brick.
So we are only passing multipathing option to cinder for exporting &
mapping the volume to paths but not while creating the connector object
and hence doing multipathing partially.
This patch passes that option and fixes the stated issue.

Related-Bug: #1863983

Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I82979c47ec9ec1dd6cc864d3827ab219177251f8
(cherry picked from commit 04e5ead7c000211a4c10104ed2bb65c9df7681ae)
'}]
commit_message:
Pass multipath config while creating connector object

Currently we only pass the configured multipath option when getting
the connector properties and do not pass it when creating the
connector object which in turn does the multipathing in os-brick.
So we are only passing multipathing option to cinder for exporting &
mapping the volume to paths but not while creating the connector object
and hence doing multipathing partially.
This patch passes that option and fixes the stated issue.

Related-Bug: #1863983

Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I82979c47ec9ec1dd6cc864d3827ab219177251f8
(cherry picked from commit 04e5ead7c000211a4c10104ed2bb65c9df7681ae)

OpenStack Release Team's release-test project ACL inherit from the
openstack/meta-config project which grants them branch deletion
access. In order to not affect the openstack/releases project
initially, split release-test out to have a separate ACL. This

commit_message:
OpenStack release-test ACLs inherit meta-config

As a first step toward automation for branch deletion, have the
OpenStack Release Team's release-test project ACL inherit from the
openstack/meta-config project which grants them branch deletion
access. In order to not affect the openstack/releases project
initially, split release-test out to have a separate ACL. This
change can be reverted once we're ready to proceed with adding this
inheritance to all openstack/ namespace ACLs.

Change-Id: I9cd3b31c41b9dc35c06db83f45e9ed70e09249dc

I'm clear what you what to catch now.

commit_message:
fix cannot collection memory.usage bug

1. when shutdown vm with long time, the libvirt while
raise libvirtError: Timed out during operation: cannot
acquire state change lock (held by
remoteDispatchDomainShutdown), if occur, all the vm in
the Physics host can not get memory.usage meter anymore!

Change-Id: I7094dac28cd4d938a4dc46e30e44ecd46e192a93
Closes-Bug: #1770295

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-12 21:07:30.000000000', 'message': '[ovn] Use normalized remote prefix IPs in OVN driver

OVN firewall driver can't silently normalize CIRDs given in
the security group rule's "remote_ip_prefix".
Because of that if user created rule with not normalized CIDR, it
wasn't applied by the OVN driver.
Now OVN driver will normalize such rules before applying them.

The OVN driver will now also check if SG rules with same normalized
and same direction, port range, protocol and ethertype already exists in
the SG. If so, it will not add or remove rule in the OVN.
Rule will be added or removed only if there is no other same rules in
the SG.

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/common/acl.py
    networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I0d9295545384844e81b0ffe3aa7483324f9a9ae5
Related-Bug: #1869129

commit_message:
[ovn] Use normalized remote prefix IPs in OVN driver

OVN firewall driver can't silently normalize CIRDs given in
the security group rule's "remote_ip_prefix".
Because of that if user created rule with not normalized CIDR, it
wasn't applied by the OVN driver.
Now OVN driver will normalize such rules before applying them.

The OVN driver will now also check if SG rules with same normalized
and same direction, port range, protocol and ethertype already exists in
the SG. If so, it will not add or remove rule in the OVN.
Rule will be added or removed only if there is no other same rules in
the SG.

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/common/acl.py
    networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I0d9295545384844e81b0ffe3aa7483324f9a9ae5
Related-Bug: #1869129
(cherry picked from commit 17f2ba3afbbbb929155c2ac3fa396784badd981b)

commit_message:
Move extra vars cli option to narg type

The json dict type is difficult to write to the cli.
Using the narg type match with ansible-playbook cli format.
For example:
--extra-vars undercloud_ram=7

Change-Id: I645589dd9f23d2daa3b0922ee10848bb8967e13b

commit_message:
Reorganize scenario tests

Create protocol specific manager classes
where we can abstract away common code
to handle access rules and mount operations
and re-use these in the tests to get adequate
coverage to the three protocols we support
in these tests currently.

Change-Id: I7e63434e745cc1c2a5e8aaccc20f7c31404742d9
Closes-Bug: #1921369
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: [K8S] Allow addon service account to access privileged PodSecurityPolicy
messages:
[{'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-04-13 01:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-04-13 08:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

PSP is deprecated from v1.21.0 and due to be removed completely rom v1.25.0 [0]. Do we still think this is a good idea?

[0] https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/policy/pod-security-policy/'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-04-13 10:08:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> PSP is deprecated from v1.21.0 and due to be removed completely rom v1.25.0 [0]. Do we still think this is a good idea?
> 
> [0] https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/policy/pod-security-policy/

Yes, you are right. But that doesn't mean we should ignore this issue until migrating to something else when v1.25 is released. The PSP is not going anywhere but replaced by something else.

Currently, without this fix, a normal k8s user is able to create pods with privileged permissions which is high risky security issue."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-04-13 23:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-04-16 11:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This one is high priority because https://review.opendev.org/q/I053808fac72a63af7ebf6f33d94659134b6cbdac breaks spawning of new clusters. We need to either revert https://review.opendev.org/q/I053808fac72a63af7ebf6f33d94659134b6cbdac for now and bundle both PS into a single patch or approve this soon.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2021-04-16 12:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Please revert to a working state and then we can do the change if we want to approve fast. Otherwise we can properly review this before merging (provide instructions to reproduce and proof that conformance is passing). 

If I'm not mistaken the offending change was a fast track merge and backport.

Can we do all this on Monday and not Friday afternoon?"}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-04-16 13:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> Please revert to a working state and then we can do the change if we want to approve fast. Otherwise we can properly review this before merging (provide instructions to reproduce and proof that conformance is passing). 
> 
> If I'm not mistaken the offending change was a fast track merge and backport.
> 
> Can we do all this on Monday and not Friday afternoon?

I have reverted the changes and it would be good if it was combined with this patch as it is a single line. It is frustrating that it was part of the recent release we made for Victoria so we will need to make another new point release with the revert."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-04-19 01:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks @Bharat. I will add `--use-service-account-credentials=true` in this patch after the revert is merged.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-13 01:35:18.000000000', 'message': '[K8S] Allow addon service account to access privileged PodSecurityPolicy

Usage of PodSecurityPolicy was fixed by a previous patch:
https://review.opendev.org/q/I053808fac72a63af7ebf6f33d94659134b6cbdac

Now, kube-controller-manager is using different service accounts for
different controllers instead of admin user previously.

As a result, all the service accounts for the addon compoments need to
have the right permission for installation, especially for those who
need to access security sensitive information in the system.

Change-Id: I88dd61a916cb31ee9ef66367ad78f5ed1546dd13
'}, {'created': '2021-04-13 23:26:56.000000000', 'message': '[K8S] Allow addon service account to access privileged PodSecurityPolicy

Usage of PodSecurityPolicy was fixed by a previous patch:
https://review.opendev.org/q/I053808fac72a63af7ebf6f33d94659134b6cbdac

Now, kube-controller-manager is using different service accounts for
different controllers instead of admin user previously.

As a result, all the service accounts for the addon compoments need to
have the right permission for installation, especially for those who
need to access security sensitive information in the system.

Change-Id: I88dd61a916cb31ee9ef66367ad78f5ed1546dd13
'}]
commit_message:
[K8S] Allow addon service account to access privileged PodSecurityPolicy

Usage of PodSecurityPolicy was fixed by a previous patch:
https://review.opendev.org/q/I053808fac72a63af7ebf6f33d94659134b6cbdac

Now, kube-controller-manager is using different service accounts for
different controllers instead of admin user previously.

As a result, all the service accounts for the addon compoments need to
have the right permission for installation, especially for those who
need to access security sensitive information in the system.

Change-Id: I88dd61a916cb31ee9ef66367ad78f5ed1546dd13

commit_message:
Fix wrong args when calling unbind() method

The `unbind()` takes 2 positional arguments but 3 were given in
 `apply_patch()`. This patch fixes it.

Story: #2008736
Task: #42088
Change-Id: Ibb8beb38e20933c548683f08ee3565dfd6632977

Adding Giulio and Francesco since they're involved in cephadm. It is not currently packaged in rhel repo rhceph-4-tools-for-rhel-8-x86_64-rpms.

Is cephadm in a different rhel repo? Should we land this now to fix rhel-8 builds or do something else?"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-02-25 07:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-02-25 10:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Adding Giulio and Francesco since they're involved in cephadm. It is not currently packaged in rhel repo rhceph-4-tools-for-rhel-8-x86_64-rpms.

this will be in rhceph-5-tools-for-rhel-8-x86_64-rpms which isn't in fact available yet ... we have it in centos8 cbs only for now
 
> Is cephadm in a different rhel repo? Should we land this now to fix rhel-8 builds or do something else?

I think I understand the problem but I am not 100% about the implications of this change; I think the upstream jobs are using c8 based and are installing this from the centos cbs infra

Is "periodic-tripleo-ci-rhel-8-scenario001-standalone-rhos-17" the only rhel8 job we have? we are migrating scenario001 to cephadm upstream and I guess at that point cephadm will be necessary on the rhel8 image

Would it make sense to install the cbs version until we have it in the rhel repos?'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-04-13 11:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-04-16 09:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

not sure what problem this is meant to fix?'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-04-18 21:02:49.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'll just assume that cephadm is packaged for rhel-8 when its necessary"}]

commit_message:
Don't install cephadm on rhel-8

This tool is not packaged for rhel, since it just sets up repos to
install ceph from, and this is handled by rhel subscriptions.

Change-Id: Ib9c3444c4592047c8ddf03631e95e51067d280c8

commit_message:
Handle multiple projects for flavor access

Add possibility to configure acces project for flavor
to multiple projects.
Also deprecate the "project" option which is supposed to be replace
slowly by "projects".

Change-Id: Ibde314fc3c445f62196b68da78cceb7af9d94674

subject: configuring neutron-api-uwsgi.ini
messages:
[{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-02 21:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-03 11:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-05-03 15:10:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is not purely OpenStack related though, this would mean uwsgi would become an official way to deploy API services in Puppet OpenStack and this should be fixed for all modules, is that something you'd want to have done and how would you implement that?"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-03 19:11:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Tobias. In Debian, uwsgi is already the standard, in the packages, for all of the OpenStack APIs. There's nothing to be done on the puppet side, just run the service. What I would like to do here, is just make it possible to configure the /etc/SERVICE/SERVICE-api-uwsgi.ini that comes with all OpenStack packages.

Yes, I would like to do it for all services. I just start with Neutron, to see how it goes. I will then make it so things like number of workers can be configured by default using this neutron_uwsgi_config thing, for example."}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-03 19:17:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tobias,

I've opened a mailing list thread, since it may be more easy to discuss the topic there."}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-11 14:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-11 15:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-11 19:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-05-11 22:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-20 01:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

The implementation almost looks good. The problem is mostly about test codes.

Also, can you add a release note because this is a new feature ?'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-05-20 08:39:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Not sure what I think about this change, I was hoping we could introduce an more abstract layer to adding different WSGI serving applications like httpd is today.

But checking around I can't see that there is any good, well maintained uWSGI module for Puppet."}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-20 12:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-20 12:15:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-21 12:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-21 12:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-21 13:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-25 10:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-26 08:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-05-27 17:29:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Still think this needs more thinking over on how to implement it instead of just winging it and implementing new resource providers.

What is the long term plan here? How can we integrate uWSGI more seamlessly, why should OpenStack related Puppet code configure uWSGI related things, it's like we would introduce resource providers to configure Apache, doesn't make sense."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-06-24 06:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sorry for being late after review request.

After taking some time, I agree with Tobias about his thought for some extent.

However, oh the other hand, problem is that I can't find any popular puppet module for uwsgi, which is now actively maintained.

So I think what we can do would be to implement a provider and a base class in openstacklib instead of implementing provider codes in all puppet modules, and use the common class from each puppet modules as we do for openstacklib::wsgi::apache for example."}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2021-04-18 16:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

A better patch has just been merged.'}]

commit_message:
configuring neutron-api-uwsgi.ini

Debian uses uwsgi to run all of OpenStack API. This patch is a first
attempt to allow puppet-openstack to configure it. This patch includes:
- configuring of /etc/neutron/neutron-api-uwsgi.ini using a new provider
called neutron_uwsgi_config
- forward of $api_worker in neutron::server to neutron_uwsgi_config

Change-Id: Id9d14c06abc12547ad2ca894b369baf864e6418b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 14:02:25.000000000', 'message': "Add locks for setting iptables rules in l3 and metadata agents

Router_info class and metadata agent's driver are using same
instance of the iptables manager class and it could happend that
sometimes e.g. nat rule which packets send to 169.254.169.254:80
redirects to the port 9697 so haproxy can process them, can be missed as
they will be overwritten by the Router_info class manipulating other
rules in the same 'nat' rules list.

This patch fixed that by adding lock for methods which are changing
rules in iptables_manager's nat table in both router_info and
the metadata agent's driver.

Closes-Bug: #1920778
Change-Id: Ic3a324c0e608c7afc4b15dbc8becd33b75ee78f6
(cherry picked from commit af3c1b84427cbe4c9d3dce8fc901ad0b099c5917)
"}]
commit_message:
Add locks for setting iptables rules in l3 and metadata agents

Router_info class and metadata agent's driver are using same
instance of the iptables manager class and it could happend that
sometimes e.g. nat rule which packets send to 169.254.169.254:80
redirects to the port 9697 so haproxy can process them, can be missed as
they will be overwritten by the Router_info class manipulating other
rules in the same 'nat' rules list.

This patch fixed that by adding lock for methods which are changing
rules in iptables_manager's nat table in both router_info and
the metadata agent's driver.

Closes-Bug: #1920778
Change-Id: Ic3a324c0e608c7afc4b15dbc8becd33b75ee78f6
(cherry picked from commit af3c1b84427cbe4c9d3dce8fc901ad0b099c5917)

I think we need to collect the tempestconf.log on these runs, because it's pretty hard to identify from the role why it fails, since ansible only return failure and the error code."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-03-31 07:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-03-31 07:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-01 14:38:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> I think we need to collect the tempestconf.log on these runs, because it's pretty hard to identify from the role why it fails, since ansible only return failure and the error code.

Ok, so we're setting http along the way and then for some reason decide to reach https o_O https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/450711ee543245dd8b818a72a8b300d6/log/logs/openstack/aio1-utility/tempestconf.log.txt#37"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-01 15:12:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:

> Ok, so we're setting http along the way and then for some reason decide to reach https o_O https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/450711ee543245dd8b818a72a8b300d6/log/logs/openstack/aio1-utility/tempestconf.log.txt#37

So, tempestconf has hardcoded endpoint without any option to set it https://opendev.org/osf/python-tempestconf/src/branch/master/config_tempest/clients.py#L106

Eventually it does not read any insecure/endpoint options out of mentioned in https://docs.openstack.org/python-tempestconf/latest/user/profile.html#generating-a-sample-profile-yaml-file 

So we should mark it as nv until will be placing root CA for public endpoint SSL."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-01 15:17:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-04-18 09:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}]

[{'created': '2021-04-15 01:51:40.000000000', 'message': 'update grub2 file name

Some higher versions of grub2 (e.g. 2.05 or 2.06-rc1) use
grub.cfg-01-MAC, while another lower versions of
grub2 (e.g. 2.04) use MAC.conf, so we generate both paths
in order to be compatible with both.

For more information we can see:
https://docs.oracle.com/en/operating-systems/oracle-linux/7/install/ol7-install-prepare.html#ol7-install-pxe-boot-uefi

Change-Id: Icbdd284de38b8e54c52cdbba709bba0e644c35cd
Signed-off-by: Armstrong Liu <vpbvmw651078@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8f474bfe598849d0dfffb4ede11057f0411dde3c)
'}]
commit_message:
update grub2 file name

Some higher versions of grub2 (e.g. 2.05 or 2.06-rc1) use
grub.cfg-01-MAC, while another lower versions of
grub2 (e.g. 2.04) use MAC.conf, so we generate both paths
in order to be compatible with both.

For more information we can see:
https://docs.oracle.com/en/operating-systems/oracle-linux/7/install/ol7-install-prepare.html#ol7-install-pxe-boot-uefi

Change-Id: Icbdd284de38b8e54c52cdbba709bba0e644c35cd
Signed-off-by: Armstrong Liu <vpbvmw651078@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8f474bfe598849d0dfffb4ede11057f0411dde3c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-07 11:16:02.000000000', 'message': 'Use subqueryload() instead of joinedload() for (system_)metadata

Currently, when we "get" a single instance from the database and we
load metadata and system_metadata, we do so using a joinedload() which
does JOINs with the respective tables. Because of the one-to-many
relationship between an instance and (system_)metadata records, doing
the database query this way can result in a large number of additional
rows being returned unnecessarily and cause a large data transfer.

This is similar to the problem addressed by change
I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9 which added separate queries
for (system_)metadata when we "get" multiple instances. We don't,
however, reuse the same code for this change because
_instances_fill_metadata converts the instance database object to a
dict, and some callers of _instance_get_by_uuid need to be able to
access an instance database object attached to the session (example:
instance_update_and_get_original).

By using subqueryload() [1], we can perform the additional queries for
(system_)metadata to solve the problem with a similar approach.

Closes-Bug: #1799298

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/loading_relationships.html#subquery-eager-loading

Change-Id: I5c071f70f669966e9807b38e99077c1cae5b4606
(cherry picked from commit e728fe668a6de886455f2dbaf655c8a151462c8c)
(cherry picked from commit e2dc0de478ed16c2a811cde4aaa52f756c758fb5)
(cherry picked from commit 12dbfec3ef4d1298a075bcd94ab3c5d8e7af5475)
(cherry picked from commit bdf25512ed34f3d76afd607e0adc49394035194e)
(cherry picked from commit 012d628a7909fd50619563a6a591b1d35ab8db10)

rows being returned unnecessarily and cause a large data transfer.

This is similar to the problem addressed by change
I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9 which added separate queries
for (system_)metadata when we "get" multiple instances. We don't,
however, reuse the same code for this change because
_instances_fill_metadata converts the instance database object to a
dict, and some callers of _instance_get_by_uuid need to be able to
access an instance database object attached to the session (example:
instance_update_and_get_original).

By using subqueryload() [1], we can perform the additional queries for
(system_)metadata to solve the problem with a similar approach.

Closes-Bug: #1799298

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/loading_relationships.html#subquery-eager-loading

commit_message:
Use subqueryload() instead of joinedload() for (system_)metadata

Currently, when we "get" a single instance from the database and we
load metadata and system_metadata, we do so using a joinedload() which
does JOINs with the respective tables. Because of the one-to-many
relationship between an instance and (system_)metadata records, doing
the database query this way can result in a large number of additional
rows being returned unnecessarily and cause a large data transfer.

This is similar to the problem addressed by change
I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9 which added separate queries
for (system_)metadata when we "get" multiple instances. We don't,
however, reuse the same code for this change because
_instances_fill_metadata converts the instance database object to a
dict, and some callers of _instance_get_by_uuid need to be able to
access an instance database object attached to the session (example:
instance_update_and_get_original).

By using subqueryload() [1], we can perform the additional queries for
(system_)metadata to solve the problem with a similar approach.

Closes-Bug: #1799298

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/loading_relationships.html#subquery-eager-loading

Change-Id: I5c071f70f669966e9807b38e99077c1cae5b4606
(cherry picked from commit e728fe668a6de886455f2dbaf655c8a151462c8c)
(cherry picked from commit 63d2e62c3a223f883ca810f4c66a2a236cf3d483)
(cherry picked from commit e7a45e0335e4cf44fec7f7b8d2505f5b95445cf9)

(cherry picked from commit ad7e4fb8f4ea6c458af00ec7aa0b321dc37c097c)

commit_message:
Install mysql client libraries

Adjutant uses mysqlclient python module to connect to
mysql. It requires mysql libraries to be present both during wheel build
and while usage. So mysqlclient libraries should be present at any time.

We also adjutant pip package from a constraint to a requirement as part
of new pip resolver task

Change-Id: I56ec209d0e80339cfa275a15bc8c3ff0891b5eae

commit_message:
Reuse _set_instances_share_data for replicas.

Replicas are just special instances after all, no need for
duplicate code and missing on improvements like exception handling
on NotFound error.

Change-Id: I31fabebc6a60814a4cfc04ae0deb49dcb66cab0f
Closes-Bug: #1923566

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I05c2e535b730bcf14a532ba103cf28c79e03c8af

Instead of using process_event('fail') use error_handlers,
otherwise in case of failure node gets stuck and fails
because of timeout, instead of failing earlier due to
step failure.

And improve coverage to test this error handling
and also happy paths.

Story: 2008307
Task: 41197
Change-Id: I1e957c2b526abc37920212b6431b11eedc9f89be

commit_message:
Fix idrac-wsman BIOS step async error handling

Instead of using process_event('fail') use error_handlers,
otherwise in case of failure node gets stuck and fails
because of timeout, instead of failing earlier due to
step failure.

And improve coverage to test this error handling
and also happy paths.

Story: 2008307
Task: 41197
Change-Id: I1e957c2b526abc37920212b6431b11eedc9f89be
(cherry picked from commit 83ce7c4264a57658fb749c740e6b32e3eb6a906b)

commit_message:
Remove check if set_extra_attr_value is run in the transaction

We moved all our code to the new enginefacade already so we don't use
nested transactions at all thus we don't need that check anymore.

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

Change-Id: I957151a7cac4285926864029c844efd76b052c5b

[{'created': '2021-04-15 12:22:10.000000000', 'message': "Add is_metal variable

In functional tests, comparing to the integrtion ones, dynamic inventroy
is not used. Thus, ``is_metal`` variable is not defined, and we rely on
it in some roles.

To cover the gap, we're setting a variable based on the ansible_facts for
functional tests only.

Change-Id: Ifc9bb5bb65d599a39f562faaaa14a0756e493ba1
"}]
commit_message:
Add is_metal variable

In functional tests, comparing to the integrtion ones, dynamic inventroy
is not used. Thus, ``is_metal`` variable is not defined, and we rely on
it in some roles.

To cover the gap, we're setting a variable based on the ansible_facts for
functional tests only.

Change-Id: Ifc9bb5bb65d599a39f562faaaa14a0756e493ba1

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix "name" parameter

Prior to this change, the "name" field in
the response for "Update a snapshot's metadata"
referred to volume transfers instead of snapshots.

Make "name" a generic parameter in case it is reused
in other APIs, and make specific parameters for
snapshots and transfers.

(Similar to I0b0a692139)

Change-Id: Ifb93bd1b20c216fd29ea90c4ac70709bee569d1d

commit_message:
Update release note info

- add a link to make the release note info easier to find in the
  contributor guide to increase the likelihood that people will
  actually follow the standard format
- add some guidance about using past tense to describe fixes
- update the sample notes to reflect the above

Change-Id: Iddf0b3de4ba44f9b14d2e144097b51fd7a4ccf61

pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:

Change-Id: I665af00166cfbb49b160afce0703530de03977b5

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I665af00166cfbb49b160afce0703530de03977b5

commit_message:
Stop publishing on release

We don't support these images, no need to waste CI resources on
them. More so if they might end up being faulty.

Change-Id: I3259c0736a296751129aa349e8d378c0123957e6

Move adjutant pip package from a constraint to a requirement

This is necessary to support the new pip resolver.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-16 14:57:23.000000000', 'message': "pylint: Fix E1120 no-value-for-parameter for mocks

Currently pylint is returning E1120 errors such as

 No value for argument 'mock_clean' in method call
 (no-value-for-parameter)

These are not correct and are cause by the mock decorator modifying the
parameters received by the method, as mentioned in
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/259

This patch adds the configuration option signature-mutators to pylint
telling it that patch and patch.object mutate the method signatures.

Change-Id: Iac8cd96c87b7d812a937ba7d978034c37fc2eedd
"}]
commit_message:
pylint: Fix E1120 no-value-for-parameter for mocks

Currently pylint is returning E1120 errors such as

 No value for argument 'mock_clean' in method call
 (no-value-for-parameter)

These are not correct and are cause by the mock decorator modifying the
parameters received by the method, as mentioned in
https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/259

This patch adds the configuration option signature-mutators to pylint
telling it that patch and patch.object mutate the method signatures.

Change-Id: Iac8cd96c87b7d812a937ba7d978034c37fc2eedd

commit_message:
Add Python3 xena unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for xena.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I35436231492a33a2b5b4bc223082a9482b62ea1d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-25 12:00:17.000000000', 'message': 'Improve error log when snapshot fails

If snapshot creation via glance fails due to lack of space or over
quota, we want to have a clearer error message.

Change-Id: Ic9133f6bc14d4fe766d37a438bf52c33e89da768
Closes-Bug: #1613770
(cherry picked from commit 024bf10d8aec5e58111793a9652b16682eb61b7c)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve error log when snapshot fails

If snapshot creation via glance fails due to lack of space or over
quota, we want to have a clearer error message.

Change-Id: Ic9133f6bc14d4fe766d37a438bf52c33e89da768
Closes-Bug: #1613770
(cherry picked from commit 024bf10d8aec5e58111793a9652b16682eb61b7c)

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: Ic41b5cf5eb211603e23205a0e805d8ac8fe1f913

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: Ic41b5cf5eb211603e23205a0e805d8ac8fe1f913

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I2872eee0bd43dcef75a1508d7f707823fb6eccfa

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 09:15:05.000000000', 'message': 'DHCP notification optimization

DHCP notification is done after each create/update/delete for
network, subnet and port.
This notification currently has to retrieve network from DB almost
every time, which is a quite heavy DB request and hence affects
performance of port and subnet CRUD.

This patch suggests 2 optimizations:
- do not fetch network if not needed (only fetch when schedule needed)
- for port and subnet AFTER_CREATE event pass network dict from plugin

According to Rally tests these changes improve performance:
- port create ~20%
- port update ~20%
- subnet create ~15%
- port delete and subnet update/delete - not tested

Closes-Bug: #1923161
Change-Id: I0ab836ac09225f4f3ad435e9ceaf315018855d52

commit_message:
DHCP notification optimization

DHCP notification is done after each create/update/delete for
network, subnet and port.
This notification currently has to retrieve network from DB almost
every time, which is a quite heavy DB request and hence affects
performance of port and subnet CRUD.

This patch suggests 2 optimizations:
- do not fetch network if not needed (only fetch when schedule needed)
- for port and subnet AFTER_CREATE event pass network dict from plugin

According to Rally tests these changes improve performance:
- port create ~20%
- port update ~20%
- subnet create ~15%
- port delete and subnet update/delete - not tested

Closes-Bug: #1923161
Change-Id: I0ab836ac09225f4f3ad435e9ceaf315018855d52

commit_message:
Copy the inventory for standalone deploy in output_dir

In order to be re-used by post deployment action, this review
copy the ansible inventory into the output_dir as:
standalone-inventory.yaml.
If file exist it will replace the old one.

Change-Id: Ied14f40cf074755225abe1e8f1c859bacbe9022f
(cherry picked from commit 0736e447f9f8a075aaf5de0b40e4d20428e2c7ce)

commit_message:
Switch tempestconf centos-8-stream nodes and set as NV

Tempestconf has hardcoded [1] usage of publicURL without any option to
rewrite that. This results in CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED since we don't
have trusted certificate for public endpoint.

We mark job as NV till implementation of PKI topic [2]

[1] https://opendev.org/osf/python-tempestconf/src/branch/master/config_tempest/clients.py#L106
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs/+/758805

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/784009
Change-Id: I29ecf06fc625ef0d93424ce8e04bb592cb2ce07b

commit_message:
Use ceph_mon_network to find Ceph monitor IPs for export

When 'openstack overcloud export ceph' is run, do not assume
the storage_ip will be set. Instead, find the ceph_mon_network
name in the service_net_map, e.g. 'storage' or 'ctlplane', and
then use that network name to get the IP from the inventory.

Closes-Bug: #1922788
Change-Id: I962bed846b2cae7206c76f883f9294d366031245
(cherry picked from commit 1e690136913062dc0b14b328a295f34fb1c02bd1)
(cherry picked from commit 1683e1bff97bf0d0db6221fc6d56ed8069f1e5d7)
(cherry picked from commit 226a9078711a89a90b0c270c51bf911a8d16c421)

commit_message:
Add some debug to async_wait failures

This dumps some data in the case where we fail to wait for a child
pid to help debug what is going on. This also cleans up a few review
comments from the actual fix.

Change-Id: I7b58ce0cf2b41bdffa448973edb4c992fe5f730c
Related-Bug: #1923728

subject: Revert "Revert "Fix a couple of Swift healthchecks""
messages: [{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-04-12 10:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-04-12 14:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-04-16 09:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-12 10:33:48.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Fix a couple of Swift healthchecks""

This reverts commit 750b562521b507aab555862f01b74e56f8119861.

Depending on the used procps version, the output of "ps -e" is width
limited and thus not matching the quite long process names. Using
"ps -ef" fixes this, along with a small hack in the piped grep to filter
out grep itself (pgrep itself is not working for this).

Removes swift-*-replicator because it does not seem to be used
anymore in any of the container build configurations.

This change removes the renames from the previous commit because they
are backwards incompatible depending on how the containers are built. We
use healthcheck from the openstack-tripleo-common-containers-base which
is a package. If this package does not have the new file names (or old
filenames) and the containers are built with a different version of
tripleo-common, the container builds fail.  So let's skip renaming of
files so that we can deal with that as a separate issue as a whole.

Change-Id: I3e58de46835307d4332b34d22d2895e6382292dd
(cherry picked from commit 21fd04f038e1a90223e156082f780501846fde3c)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Fix a couple of Swift healthchecks""

This reverts commit 750b562521b507aab555862f01b74e56f8119861.

Depending on the used procps version, the output of "ps -e" is width
limited and thus not matching the quite long process names. Using
"ps -ef" fixes this, along with a small hack in the piped grep to filter
out grep itself (pgrep itself is not working for this).

Removes swift-*-replicator because it does not seem to be used
anymore in any of the container build configurations.

This change removes the renames from the previous commit because they
are backwards incompatible depending on how the containers are built. We
use healthcheck from the openstack-tripleo-common-containers-base which
is a package. If this package does not have the new file names (or old
filenames) and the containers are built with a different version of
tripleo-common, the container builds fail.  So let's skip renaming of
files so that we can deal with that as a separate issue as a whole.

Change-Id: I3e58de46835307d4332b34d22d2895e6382292dd
(cherry picked from commit 21fd04f038e1a90223e156082f780501846fde3c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-16 14:57:23.000000000', 'message': 'pylint: Fix E0213 no-self-argument in tests

We have a couple of methods in our unit tests that are not calling self
by that name, which confuses pylint and triggers error E0213.

This patch fixes those cases to reduce noise in pylint.

Change-Id: I3383e3da21657845741b451e60231e1281196546
'}]
commit_message:
pylint: Fix E0213 no-self-argument in tests

We have a couple of methods in our unit tests that are not calling self
by that name, which confuses pylint and triggers error E0213.

This patch fixes those cases to reduce noise in pylint.

Change-Id: I3383e3da21657845741b451e60231e1281196546

subject: Drop lower-constraints job
messages: [{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-04-09 19:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2021-04-16 14:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nYou get a merge!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 19:10:11.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I6ee0fde63018ba68dadb976404e99b6137e84b05
'}]
commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I6ee0fde63018ba68dadb976404e99b6137e84b05

commit_message:
Add new Update validation groups.

Add all the needed groups to cover the different
stages for the Update workflow.

Change-Id: If565e63377e02eed153553a54eba58c65c07585c
(cherry picked from commit a6ed71e94d81f25fcf210e705b2aa90125fa1bcf)

commit_message:
Remove the stable branch jobs from stable/ussuri gate

devstack-plugin-ceph is now branched, and each branch
will maintain the respective branch specific code and
testing.

Any job running on ussuri gate will be against the stable/ussuri
OpenStack. This also removes the stable branch specific-jobs definition.

Change-Id: Ib0e03f1d6760b399f78ea3cded973216486c3c12

Make availability zone type exception easier to understand.

The current message that users get is hard to decipher.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 13:00:28.000000000', 'message': 'Do a quick FIP check on network delete

Get FloatingIP object results in a quite heavy DB request.

A simple and quick check at the beginning of
delete_disassociated_floatingips() significantly
improves performance for deleting non-external networks
not having any floating IPs, which seems the most common case.

Change-Id: I6a40e6e3f937fa30bbb29768211ec8e689d4f82a
'}, {'created': '2021-04-10 05:46:12.000000000', 'message': 'Do a quick FIP check on network delete

Get FloatingIP object results in a quite heavy DB request.

A simple and quick check at the beginning of
delete_disassociated_floatingips() significantly
improves performance for deleting non-external networks
not having any floating IPs, which seems the most common case.

Change-Id: I6a40e6e3f937fa30bbb29768211ec8e689d4f82a
'}, {'created': '2021-04-12 16:14:13.000000000', 'message': 'Get only FIP ID on network delete

Get FloatingIP object results in a quite heavy DB request.
delete_disassociated_floatingips() only needs IDs.

Change-Id: I6a40e6e3f937fa30bbb29768211ec8e689d4f82a
'}, {'created': '2021-04-13 08:28:07.000000000', 'message': 'Get only FIP ID on network delete

Get FloatingIP object results in a quite heavy DB request.
delete_disassociated_floatingips() only needs IDs.

Change-Id: I6a40e6e3f937fa30bbb29768211ec8e689d4f82a
'}]
commit_message:
Get only FIP ID on network delete

Get FloatingIP object results in a quite heavy DB request.
delete_disassociated_floatingips() only needs IDs.

Change-Id: I6a40e6e3f937fa30bbb29768211ec8e689d4f82a

Elasticsearch: Add configurable backoffLimit to templates job

This change allows us to control the backofflimit for this job

Change-Id: I9c3ccc0842a0e5c31b7838576648dae966b15a6e

commit_message:
Tests: Solidfire - Use UUIDs in object UUID fields

A number of tests here throw warnings from
oslo.versionedobjects when run because UUIDFields
are populated with data other than UUIDs.

Clean this up in the tests.

Change-Id: I01456ec2000557ab4d0723a287b87356361f5cd4

commit_message:
Refactor the lvm barbican job(s): cinderlib-less variant

The first real cinderlib supported branch works with train,
so restructure the lvm/barbican jobs to disable cinderlib testing
with any branch older than train.
While those branches are in Extended Maintenance status,
the job may be still used there to remove their old legacy
counterpart to easy the maintenance.

Change-Id: I5fa1b2d0348e86988f616dd7404dedc4eb9c4666

commit_message:
Ceph jobs: re-enable a few c-bak tests, add more jobs

Those tests were disabled when ceph was upgraded
to a newer release (I51c90e592070b99422e692d5e9e97083d93146e8)
because they were failing.
But it seems they are working now, and it is not not trivial
at this point to understand whether something was fixed
in ceph or in cinder, so let's re-enable them.

Also, add a few additional (initially experimental) jobs
to double-check the ceph/c-bak scenario against
the stable branches.

This reverts commit 9d626d0de5ebddbe359b3f3bf0dae4c6e45efaad
and adds more functionalities.

Change-Id: I033e0dc04f342e27d6266ad412d3cb256787c0e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 17:09:27.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: Fix "id" parameter

The parameter "id" was used for volume transfer
and other various APIs, resulting in things like
consistency group snapshot APIs indicating that
they return volume snapshot ids.

Make "id" generic for those cases and make a
specific "transfer_id" parameter for volume
transfers to prevent this problem in other
places.

Change-Id: I0b0a69213910c33570453cd961e10e22941369e9
'}, {'created': '2021-03-08 17:10:15.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: Fix "id" parameter

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix "id" parameter

The parameter "id" was used for volume transfer
and other various APIs, resulting in things like
consistency group snapshot APIs indicating that
they return volume transfer ids.

Make "id" generic for those cases and make a
specific "transfer_id" parameter for volume
transfers to prevent this problem in other
places.

Change-Id: I0b0a69213910c33570453cd961e10e22941369e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-02 00:51:39.000000000', 'message': '[doc] remove outdated package python-keystone

openstack-cinder in RDO victoria depends on python-cinder
which depends on:
python3-keystoneauth1 >= 3.14.0
python3-keystoneclient >= 1:3.15.0
python3-keystonemiddleware >= 4.21.0

closes-bug: #1916258
Change-Id: If772b29d7b59ca99c1f2796ff75ef846b3904875
'}]
commit_message:
[doc] remove outdated package python-keystone

openstack-cinder in RDO victoria depends on python-cinder
which depends on:
python3-keystoneauth1 >= 3.14.0
python3-keystoneclient >= 1:3.15.0
python3-keystonemiddleware >= 4.21.0

closes-bug: #1916258
Change-Id: If772b29d7b59ca99c1f2796ff75ef846b3904875

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 19:07:40.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I299d24776389319afa2dbf59de75406950f8972e
'}]
commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I299d24776389319afa2dbf59de75406950f8972e

commit_message:
Remove uuid check/generate in service

The code to check for uuid and generate if there isn't one while
getting the service was added for an online migration which was
removed with commit[1].
Since all service entries in database have UUIDs, this code isn't
useful and can be removed.

[1] 230bda82c1ada91dcec90b21913d713795164b19

Change-Id: I31c7381f608c7434b092fc443e3c6cf7f41d9c1c

commit_message:
Allow inheritFrom in Gerrit configs

In order to utilize Gerrit's project configuration inheritance
mechanism, we need to support the inheritFrom option. Allow it in
the whitelist for our ACL normalization script.

Change-Id: Id23b348bf42d322d5c97903ad82101ac1dc01c27

commit_message:
Map requires-python to python-requires (attempt 2)

Attempt two at the problem, this time done properly. As discussed in
change I7158e75934535b80eb60d6b4b7dcef08866b5bab, the previous attempt
actually mapped 'python_requires' to 'requires_python' rather than the
other way around. This resolves that.

Change-Id: I415b64d5b51a248d2f45a28234f1635e8b82ffcc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic41b1877414e57a13a311c2effc209a22f855c6a

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I3ed9e2f0b5bcd314ab4c07b30378856d6e1bfc69

commit_message:
[Neutron] Update Rally tests

The PS updates Rally tests and removes "name" parameter. According to
Rally documentation [0] this parameter was always ignored. Latest version of Rally (2.1.0) is failing with a message: "Scenario plugin
'NeutronNetworks.<...>' doesn't pass restricted_parameters@default
validation. Details: You can't specify parameters 'name' in
'network_update_args/port_update_args/router_update_args/subnet_update_args'"

[0] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/2.1.0/CHANGELOG.rst

Change-Id: If4e80dfcb56a6e1daa1a055285329f9fc2d58332

commit_message:
Pure Storage - bump version numbers for Xena

Pure uses the version number of the driver to identify which
customers are using which versions of OpenStack.

This will help granular analysis of which driver is being
used in each OpenStack version

Change-Id: I3d3c7aa32cfa7423052fb8662849f50af3177c55

Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I03e23a62dd0bfed4dfcccbcf4415c8c354971404

commit_message:
Add new parameter required for secure RBAC configuration

Glance has added support for project persona of secure RBAC as
an experimental feature where 'enforce_secure_rbac' has been introduced.

Adding support of 'enforce_secure_rbac' parameter here.

Partially Implements: blueprint secure-rbac

Change-Id: I1db7fa2694bc9a448a47e435cfd95264504086c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-04 09:01:19.000000000', 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Id19b6e38400f7b644faeabcac6d8037603cac459
"}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Id19b6e38400f7b644faeabcac6d8037603cac459

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: If9ddf23af3a63ae89ccd8af95fd34a074ce91812

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I51a863bb5baeb51d5ec7488ddc9dd518ab56a002
"}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I51a863bb5baeb51d5ec7488ddc9dd518ab56a002

commit_message:
Add validation to verify undercloud.conf content.

This validation checks the correctness of the undercloud.conf
file. The checks run as part of the verification are:
 - All parameters assigned to a file path point to an existing
   file location in the system.
 - No deprecated parameters are included in undercloud.conf
 - All required parameters are present in undercloud.conf
 - No deprecated hw types are included in the enabled_hw_types
   parameters.

Change-Id: Ic543e21c4aa60b05991f0c4866a6408b924304fd
(cherry picked from commit 99fdf8ae6a837ba51751a642b1303a390cd94e80)

commit_message:
Add validation to verify undercloud.conf content.

This validation checks the correctness of the undercloud.conf
file. The checks run as part of the verification are:
 - All parameters assigned to a file path point to an existing
   file location in the system.
 - No deprecated parameters are included in undercloud.conf
 - All required parameters are present in undercloud.conf
 - No deprecated hw types are included in the enabled_hw_types
   parameters.

Change-Id: Ic543e21c4aa60b05991f0c4866a6408b924304fd
(cherry picked from commit 99fdf8ae6a837ba51751a642b1303a390cd94e80)
(cherry picked from commit 6b181d89057d5a97f5d23d5d0494e8a00d89a104)
(cherry picked from commit e5df5b3681497051443c012bd3629f033259f34e)

commit_message:
Fix tempest_binary in Debian

The tempest binary isn't /usr/bin/python3-tempest anymore.
Fix run_tests.sh to reflect this new reality.

Change-Id: I6d871272023a47475f18b209b049f7317cb93f4d

commit_message:
Add debug log in pick_default_policy_file

We have many if else condition to pick the
right policy filebut there is no debugging log
to have useful info to know if expected policy file
is not picked.

Change-Id: I507c58a6dca06d0cc6f306bcd063c700c18cc5f7

subject: vmware: Handle empty list attributes on vSphere objects
messages:
[{'account_id': 26250, 'date': '2021-04-14 15:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-04-14 15:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

So as far as I see this change now makes the driver compatible both with the old and the new oslo-vmware lib, therefore now min version bump is needed.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-04-14 17:48:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/786262/1/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 28m 01s'}, {'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2021-04-16 07:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-04-16 11:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-14 15:18:33.000000000', 'message': "vmware: Handle empty list attributes on vSphere objects

We want to switch the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1] and the new
library differs in how empty lists are returned. The old library SUDS
didn't set attributes if they were empty lists. The new library sets
those attributes to empty lists.

Therefore, every check with `hasattr()` that later on accesses a single
element instead of iterating over the whole list needs to be changed to
also check that the list contains elements. This ensures compatiblity
between the backend library versions.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I9322037cd47ace83fbcb19bbbe051e2feb9af2c7
"}]
commit_message:
vmware: Handle empty list attributes on vSphere objects

We want to switch the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1] and the new
library differs in how empty lists are returned. The old library SUDS
didn't set attributes if they were empty lists. The new library sets
those attributes to empty lists.

Therefore, every check with `hasattr()` that later on accesses a single
element instead of iterating over the whole list needs to be changed to
also check that the list contains elements. This ensures compatiblity
between the backend library versions.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I9322037cd47ace83fbcb19bbbe051e2feb9af2c7

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic287030481141e9674f275f76c75a3cb26edf156

commit_message:
Add support for magnum_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Magnum API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
magnum_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
magnum::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: Ibd80cee59c3a2b501e8dae1b5da4f651b6ac779d

change removes the section entirely since the information it
has is no longer relevant to the security SIG.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-14 13:12:07.000000000', 'message': 'vmware: OptionValue.value cannot be Boolean

With changing the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1], boolean types
will be represented as such in the generated XML while the previous SOAP
library always generated strings. For OptionValue objects, the vCenter
complains about an InvalidArgument when we send a boolean instead of a
string for the value attribute. Therefore, we change all occurrences to
strings.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I7659a48f0eeb28cb396e8476a3e2c4b7f027c0bb
'}]
commit_message:
vmware: OptionValue.value cannot be Boolean

With changing the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1], boolean types
will be represented as such in the generated XML while the previous SOAP
library always generated strings. For OptionValue objects, the vCenter
complains about an InvalidArgument when we send a boolean instead of a
string for the value attribute. Therefore, we change all occurrences to
strings.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I7659a48f0eeb28cb396e8476a3e2c4b7f027c0bb

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: Idb441fabc0dff9d2c6fc7a456746cd4b65ec796e

[{'created': '2021-04-14 15:06:41.000000000', 'message': "Use template URLs in Cell Mappings

In Rocky Nova has implemented templating in Cell Mappings [1]
That means that instead of hardcoding connection details in database,
we can just put a template there. Variables are parsed from nova.conf
and substituted on the service load. Thus we don't need to update cells
every time we change passoword and we can use different credentials
across nodes since they will be just taken from config files.

We also perform upgrade of the cells to the templates when cell exist.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/cells.html#template-urls-in-cell-mappings

Change-Id: Ia6bef7b902c0fb99a529c592172226bb16ed0d9d

and substituted on the service load. Thus we don't need to update cells
every time we change passoword and we can use different credentials
across nodes since they will be just taken from config files.

commit_message:
Use template URLs in Cell Mappings

In Rocky Nova has implemented templating in Cell Mappings [1]
That means that instead of hardcoding connection details in database,
we can just put a template there. Variables are parsed from nova.conf
and substituted on the service load. Thus we don't need to update cells
every time we change passoword and we can use different credentials
across nodes since they will be just taken from config files.

We also perform upgrade of the cells to the templates when cell exist.

Task `Map instances to new Cell1` is removed, since it's required to
map instances to cellv2 only during upgrade from cellsv1 to cellsv2
which is not the case nowadays or when migrating instances between
cells [2].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/cells.html#template-urls-in-cell-mappings
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/cli/nova-manage.html#nova-cells-v2
Change-Id: Ia6bef7b902c0fb99a529c592172226bb16ed0d9d

commit_message:
Remove the stable branch jobs from stable/train gate

devstack-plugin-ceph is now branched, and each branch
will maintain the respective branch specific code and
testing.

Any job running on train gate will be against the stable/train
OpenStack. This removes the stable branch specific-jobs definition
but keep the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest py2 version of job as stable/train
needs to support py2.7.

Change-Id: Ie8fcc3aec753b7ef334b47d7d86c3cbbd6919b4c

commit_message:
Use Opendev Etherpad site

To make it friendlier to non-openstack projects, use the opendev
instance of etherpad instead of the openstack one.

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I65f0c8d9138990e6c6528fad413105ef2b897e7e

commit_message:
Rbd driver caused the volume to not be deleted

For the rbd volumes, there may be residual volumes(volume-id.deleted)
on the underlying storage when you delete the parent and the clone
volumes at the same time.

Change-Id: I5a478130dec15ec2f498b1ef49164724d19a3184
Closes-Bug: #1874193

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I8418a92a5b518f027a589d233b5ee9918d7e08cf

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: I80641ff79e50cb3a519c25be712a8723367786ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 12:52:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipmitool timing argument calculation

Calculating the ipmitool `-N` and `-R` arguments from ironic.conf
[ipmi] `command_retry_timeout` and `min_command_interval` now takes
into account the 1 second interval increment that ipmitool adds on
each retry event.

Failure-path ipmitool run duration will now be just less than
`command_retry_timeout` instead of much longer.

Change-Id: Ia3d8d85497651290c62341ac121e2aa438b4ac50
(cherry picked from commit 1de3db3b16f3e0475e506e540ca5d5ed6edb4cbf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ipmitool timing argument calculation

Calculating the ipmitool `-N` and `-R` arguments from ironic.conf
[ipmi] `command_retry_timeout` and `min_command_interval` now takes
into account the 1 second interval increment that ipmitool adds on
each retry event.

Failure-path ipmitool run duration will now be just less than
`command_retry_timeout` instead of much longer.

Change-Id: Ia3d8d85497651290c62341ac121e2aa438b4ac50
(cherry picked from commit 1de3db3b16f3e0475e506e540ca5d5ed6edb4cbf)

Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

Return PyMySQL installation for distro installs

Due to error, PyMySQL installation for distro based installs was removed
with [1]

We return this behaviour back and fixing LXC distro deployments.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/742100

Change-Id: Ic03e6271695bbfd5e7166994a44af46cc0134bbd
Closes-Bug: #1922701
(cherry picked from commit b42ab487a8c0ac1798c5fc9cc7fd78615d1a6ad5)

commit_message:
Turn on mypy for nova/network/neutron.py

This patch turns on type checking for our neturon interface code. To
make mypy pass this patch adds the minimum set of type hints and does
some necessary refactoring to make the types unambiguous.

Change-Id: I82705e035c49fc88ed0dc0df4db135f51c4c7fbf

commit_message:
Introducing QemuDefaultTLSVerify parameter

This parameter will allow operators to enable or disable TLS client
certificate verification. Enabling this option will reject any client
who does not have a certificate signed by the CA in
/etc/pki/qemu/ca-cert.pem.

The default is true and matches libvirt's. We will want to disable this
by default in train.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/785957/
Change-Id: I9beb396f0debc98d6e58ce8d53311e7b60ff76c3

[{'created': '2021-04-09 18:57:32.000000000', 'message': 'WIP add module for looking up an interface by IP

Heavy testing under way.

Change-Id: I6d06d83f28e543870f6ce88435f9b7a2b3426d61
'}, {'created': '2021-04-13 17:54:25.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Adding support configuring addtional Unbound listen address

Heavy testing under way and so far missing a way to set on reboot.

Change-Id: I6d06d83f28e543870f6ce88435f9b7a2b3426d61
'}, {'created': '2021-04-14 16:53:04.000000000', 'message': 'Adding support configuring addtional Unbound listen address

Patch adds support for passing an extra IP on the public API network
(ctlplane or external as the case may be) so the unbound resolver can
reside on the same network and host as bind when it is being used as the
designate backend. The IP is set on the interface during deployment and
also hooked into ifup-local so it will be configured on boot or
ifup/ifdown of the relevant interface.

The patch includes a new ansible plugin for retrieving the interface for
a given IP.

Change-Id: I6d06d83f28e543870f6ce88435f9b7a2b3426d61
'}, {'created': '2021-04-14 19:05:52.000000000', 'message': 'Adding support configuring addtional Unbound listen address

(ctlplane or external as the case may be) so the unbound resolver can
reside on the same network and host as bind when it is being used as the
designate backend. The IP is set on the interface during deployment and
also hooked into ifup-local so it will be configured on boot or
ifup/ifdown of the relevant interface.

The patch includes a new ansible plugin for retrieving the interface for
a given IP.

Change-Id: I6d06d83f28e543870f6ce88435f9b7a2b3426d61
'}, {'created': '2021-04-15 13:54:43.000000000', 'message': 'Adding support configuring addtional Unbound listen address

commit_message:
Adding support configuring addtional Unbound listen address

Patch adds support for passing an extra IP on the public API network
(ctlplane or external as the case may be) so the unbound resolver can
reside on the same network and host as bind when it is being used as the
designate backend. The IP is set on the interface during deployment and
also hooked into ifup-local so it will be configured on boot or
ifup/ifdown of the relevant interface.

The patch includes a new ansible plugin for retrieving the interface for
a given IP.

Change-Id: I6d06d83f28e543870f6ce88435f9b7a2b3426d61

commit_message:
Fix Material theme to work with any combination of pyScss and MDI icons

':before' class doesn't work as expected with current versions of
xstatic-mdi and PyScss. It's a temporary workaround with copy ':before'
styles from MDI directly into the Material theme.

Closes-Bug: #1771559
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I969ad70065c580ba90bb0a050c7a9cf242d805ec
(cherry picked from commit f3bfa383417b270fce384fee18c5cb470cec15f7)

readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ife0711d33bba3fcde65a98be57da462cf8b06625

commit_message:
Remove the stable branch jobs from stable/victoria gate

devstack-plugin-ceph is now branched, and each branch
will maintain the respective branch specific code and
testing.

Any job running on victoria gate will be against the stable/victoria
OpenStack. This also removes the stable branch specific-jobs definition.

Change-Id: I6a3779b8843d1a010f989f2ca8cdad3874348c89

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I9791e5696bab3af4a6109e756ce791d23b9d28b1

subject: Prevent pip2 to try to update to version > 21
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-05 02:56:42.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent pip2 to try to update to version > 21

Executing "python2 /tmp/get-pip.py -U --force-reinstall" will
make pip to try to update to the latest version (currently > 21).
This causes the script to fail and abort the image creation.
This fix replaces the above command with "pip2 install -U pip"
which updates pip to the latest possible version.

Fixes bug 1914692

Change-Id: I2678e32e67d2d2ead4cca90eefe4fba1f1424302
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent pip2 to try to update to version > 21

Executing "python2 /tmp/get-pip.py -U --force-reinstall" will
make pip to try to update to the latest version (currently > 21).
This causes the script to fail and abort the image creation.
This fix replaces the above command with "pip2 install -U pip"
which updates pip to the latest possible version.

Fixes bug 1914692

Change-Id: I2678e32e67d2d2ead4cca90eefe4fba1f1424302

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-27 06:02:25.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints

Lower-constraints is not a requirement of the OpenStack Python PTI
[0] and there currently is a discussion on the mailing list [1]
about dropping the test, with the oslo team already having done
so [2].

The new dependency resolver in pip fails due to incompatible
dependency versions in our lower-constraints file, meaning that
we were never providing any real guarantees with it.

To unblock the CI, I am disabling lower-constraints job for now,
with the option to reenable it in case we fix the constraints,
and based on the outcome of the mailing list discussions and
consensus.

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Lower-constraints is not a requirement of the OpenStack Python PTI
[0] and there currently is a discussion on the mailing list [1]
about dropping the test, with the oslo team already having done
so [2].

The new dependency resolver in pip fails due to incompatible
dependency versions in our lower-constraints file, meaning that
we were never providing any real guarantees with it.

To unblock the CI, I am disabling lower-constraints job for now,
with the option to reenable it in case we fix the constraints,
and based on the outcome of the mailing list discussions and
consensus.

[0]. https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html
[1].
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019672.html
[2].
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019659.html

Change-Id: I8c647b325a6f489aaffdab474117c5451852c81e

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I138a808e799e4969af8542346289737c544a3c5e

commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version
each 2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements [2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different
versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

Change-Id: I402e708832395d95b04a5b956a19d5cc8c3f1c1f

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I69cb454902b1c153ca09bfb713d5748aa0dd532a

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: Iaf50b613e65b476671ab6298b3e076fe80cd36af

[{'created': '2021-04-16 09:25:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix airbag deployment on empty messages

PTGbot airbag deploys on empty messages (messages containing only
spaces, or /me actions). Fix this crash to avoid airbag deployment.

Change-Id: I4def945894419536fd3d340e3850007210adf17f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix airbag deployment on empty messages

PTGbot airbag deploys on empty messages (messages containing only
spaces, or /me actions). Fix this crash to avoid airbag deployment.

Change-Id: I4def945894419536fd3d340e3850007210adf17f

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I5137ec978ab66c33fa37aaa1d7812c77221bf8c7

[{'created': '2020-11-04 09:50:02.000000000', 'message': 'Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I8da7cc0740c7067052ddcf26e2da5f382f8b08a0

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie930485be156e8f3f8cf80cca5bafa1d9fb486ad

subject: Fix ~add ~del ~clean commands
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-04-16 09:11:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-04-16 13:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-16 09:11:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ~add ~del ~clean commands

The first parameter would be ignored when running ~add, ~del or
~clean commands. Fix the issue and add a test to make sure we
do not regress again.

Change-Id: If2c239e8d04ca2ea86283861617c89d77d3917ee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ~add ~del ~clean commands

The first parameter would be ignored when running ~add, ~del or
~clean commands. Fix the issue and add a test to make sure we
do not regress again.

Change-Id: If2c239e8d04ca2ea86283861617c89d77d3917ee
